meanings.definition: Lacking a coherent sequence or connection
meanings.sent1: The story was so disjointed that I couldn't follow it.
meanings.sent2: The puzzle pieces were all disjointed and didn't fit together.
meanings.sent3: The disjointed dance moves of the clown made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts felt disjointed, like scattered puzzle pieces.
meanings.sent5: The disjointed jigsaw puzzle was impossible to complete.

meanings.sent1: The old radio played a disjointed tune that was hard to recognize.
meanings.sent2: His speech was disjointed, jumping from topic to topic with no clear connection.
meanings.sent3: The disjointed conversation left everyone confused.
meanings.sent4: The disjointed wires caused the machine to malfunction.
meanings.sent5: The disjointed sentences in the book made it difficult to read.

meanings.definition: Not fitting or working together harmoniously
meanings.sent1: The colors of the painting seemed disjointed and clashed with each other.
meanings.sent2: The team's disjointed efforts led to a chaotic result.
meanings.sent3: The disjointed furniture arrangement made the room look messy.
meanings.sent4: Their disjointed opinions on the project caused delays.
meanings.sent5: The disjointed gears in the clock made it run erratically.
